User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

trying to load cams.com and icams.com


Actual results:

two different sites, neither load properly, but they do work with older versions of firefox


Expected results:

uh, they should have worked properly, there is nothing wrong with the sites
comments.author: farmfiddlin@gmail.com
comments.creator: farmfiddlin@gmail.com

comments.creator: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
comments.text:
WFM, at least I see no apparent problems:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:10.0a1) Gecko/20111101 Firefox/10.0a1

Does the issue still occur if you start Firefox in Safe Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

"there is nothing wrong with the sites"

Well...

http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=cams.com
330 Errors, 378 warning(s) 

http://validator.w3.org/check?uri=icams.com
"Sorry, I am unable to validate this document because on line 1118 it contained one or more bytes that I cannot interpret as utf-8 (in other words, the bytes found are not valid values in the specified Character Encoding). Please check both the content of the file and the character encoding indication.

The error was: utf8 "\x93" does not map to Unicode "

So, potentially those sites can cause a lot of problems.
comments.author: mozilla@ahlblom.eu
